original_table_html:
OBJECTIVE Description Topic and Pages
OBJECTIVE 20-1 Define sustainable marketing and discuss its importance. Sustainable Marketing (pp 598–600)
OBJECTIVE 20-2 Identify the major social criticisms of marketing. Social Criticisms of Marketing (pp 600–607)
OBJECTIVE 20-3 Define consumerism and environmentalism and explain how they affect marketing strategies. Consumer Actions to Promote Sustainable Marketing (pp 607–613)
OBJECTIVE 20-4 Describe the principles of sustainable marketing. Business Actions Toward Sustainable Marketing (pp 613–617)
OBJECTIVE 20-5 Explain the role of ethics in marketing. Marketing Ethics and the Sustainable Company (pp 617–620)
summary_markdown: This table outlines five learning objectives related to sustainable marketing, presented in a hierarchical structure. It begins with defining sustainable marketing and its significance (Objective 20-1), followed by an examination of major social criticisms leveled against marketing practices (Objective 20-2). The subsequent objectives delve into consumer-driven movements, specifically defining consumerism and environmentalism and their impact on marketing strategies (Objective 20-3). The table then shifts to business-oriented actions, describing the principles of sustainable marketing (Objective 20-4). Finally, it concludes by emphasizing the crucial role of ethics within the context of marketing and the sustainable company (Objective 20-5). Each objective is linked to specific topics and page ranges within the source material, indicating a progression from foundational concepts to more applied and ethical considerations.
